document.docAuthor: Machado, Renato Jose Pires & Oswald, John David
document.masterDocTitle: Morphological phylogeny and taxonomic revision of the former antlion subtribe Periclystina (Neuroptera: Myrmeleontidae: Dendroleontinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Morphological phylogeny and taxonomic revision of the former antlion subtribe Periclystina (Neuroptera: Myrmeleontidae: Dendroleontinae)

paragraph.keyLead:
- Forewing: posterior Banksian line absent, prefork area with one row of cells (two rows in some
A. secula
) ( Fig. 67c ); profemoral sense hair absent; pronotum longer than wide; male: paramere usually weakly developed, much narrower than gonarcus, mediuncus narrow, thin and acute ( Figs. 68 b–c)........................................ (
secula
species group) … 2

- Tibial spurs absent; forewing hyaline ( Fig. 74c )..............................................
A. tatarnici
sp. nov.

- Mesonotum mostly black with thin longitudinal pale lines ( Fig. 72b ); hind wing with a large rhegmal mark ( Fig. 72c ); female posterior gonapophyses with several cavisetae apically ( Figs. 72 d–e)......................................
A. secula
8 (7’) Male 9 th sternite emarginate apically ( Fig. 59d ); female posterior gonapophyses without cavisetae ( Fig. 59e )............ 9
- Male 9 th sternite not emarginate apically ( Fig. 41b ); female posterior gonapophyses with cavisetae apically ( Fig. 41e ).... 10

- Hind wing with a broad, dark transverse band in apical half ( Fig. 28c )....................................
A. arcuata

16 (15) Body mostly dark with small yellow marks; forewing with numerous brown marks surrounding the crossveins ( Fig. 33c )............................................................................................
A. bipunctata

- Body mostly grey with large yellow areas; forewing hyaline ( Fig. 65c )...................................
A. pallida

18 (17) Frons and pronotum mostly dark brown ( Figs. 70 a–b); forewing with light brown transverse lines ( Fig. 70c ); male mediuncus present ( Fig. 71c )...............................................................
A. pseudomaculata
sp. nov.

- Frons and pronotum mostly yellow ( Figs. 56 a–b); forewing without transverse lines ( Fig. 56c ); male mediuncus absent ( Fig. 57c )......................................................................................
A. maculata

- Body mostly gray; clypeus entirely pale ( Fig. 43a ); forewing mediocubital area hyaline ( Fig. 43c ).......
A. diehli
sp. nov.

20 (19) Forewing mediocubital area with dark streak interrupted medially ( Fig. 52c ).............................
A. interrupta

- Forewing mediocubital area with dark streak not interrupted medially ( Fig. 54c )............................
A. lineata
